channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Key Capitol Hill Hearings
channel.desc: Hearings, speeches and political coverage from around the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Gov. Moore on Role of States in Preserving U.S. Democracy
channel.desc: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore talks about the role of states in preserving and advancing U.S. democracy at Politics and Prose Bookstore in Washington, D.C.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Republican National Committee Elects New Chair
channel.desc: The Republican National Committee gathers for its 2025 summer meeting in Atlanta; the members are expected to elect Floridian Joe Gruters as its next party chair.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Hearing on Border Security
channel.desc: The Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Border Security and Immigration holds a hearing examining the Biden administration's handling of the border.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: California Gov. Newsom Speaks at Policy Summit
channel.desc: California Governor Gavin Newsom sits down for a discussion on his state's government policies.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Discussion on Space Force's Warfighting Strategy
channel.desc: Space security experts discuss the Space Force's warfighting strategy at an event hosted by the Atlantic Council.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Kathryn Harkup, V is for Venom - Agatha Christie's Chemicals of Death
channel.desc: Chemist Kathryn Harkup describes the science behind the poisons used in Agatha Christie's murder mystery novels. The Secret Science Club hosts this virtual event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Karen Hao, Empire of AI - Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman's OpenAI
channel.desc: Journalist Karen Hao discusses her reporting on OpenAI under the leadership of Sam Altman. The Commonwealth Club of California hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Megan Greenwell, Bad Company
channel.desc: Journalist Megan Greenwell takes a critical look at the role that private equity firms play in the U.S. economy and the impact they have on working-class Americans.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Robert George, Seeking Truth and Speaking Truth
channel.desc: Princeton University's Robert George argues that we live in an age where beliefs are derived from emotion rather than reason or faith.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Chris Sweeney, The Feather Detective - Mystery, Mayhem, and the Magnificent Life of Roxie Laybourne
channel.desc: Journalist Chris Sweeney recounts the career of ornithologist Roxie Laybourne, who became the go-to expert for the FBI, Air Force, and NASA in cases involving birds. Brookline Booksmith in Brookline, Massachusetts, hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Laura Poppick, Strata - Stories from Deep Time
channel.desc: Laura Poppick describes what can be learned about the Earth's past by studying rock layers. Harvard Book Store hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Emily Bender & Alex Hanna, The AI Con - How to Fight Big Tech's Hype & Create the Future We Want
channel.desc: Linguist Emily Bender and sociologist Alex Hanna argue that artificial intelligence can't deliver on the promises made by tech companies. Third Place Books in Lake Forest, Washington.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Adam Aleksic, Algospeak - How Social Media is Transforming the Future of Language
channel.desc: Linguist Adam Aleksic examines the effects of social media on the English language. Harvard Book Store hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Military historian Patrick O'Donnell looks at the efforts of the Marblehead Regiment of the Continental Army during the American Revolution, who, according to the author, played a crucial role in both battle and as the protectors of General Washington.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Brad Meltzer and Jon Mensch recount the plot to kill George Washington by soldiers assigned to protect him during the Revolutionary War.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Gianno Caldwell, the Day My Brother Was Murdered
channel.desc: Fox News political analyst Gianno Caldwell explores crime and justice in American cities as he recounts his 18-year-old brother's murder and its aftermath.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Kathryn Harkup, V is for Venom - Agatha Christie's Chemicals of Death
channel.desc: Chemist Kathryn Harkup describes the science behind the poisons used in Agatha Christie's murder mystery novels. The Secret Science Club hosts this virtual event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Karen Hao, Empire of AI - Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman's OpenAI
channel.desc: Journalist Karen Hao discusses her reporting on OpenAI under the leadership of Sam Altman. The Commonwealth Club of California hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Megan Greenwell, Bad Company
channel.desc: Journalist Megan Greenwell takes a critical look at the role that private equity firms play in the U.S. economy and the impact they have on working-class Americans.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Robert George, Seeking Truth and Speaking Truth
channel.desc: Princeton University's Robert George argues that we live in an age where beliefs are derived from emotion rather than reason or faith.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book TV
channel.desc: This long-running staple of the C-SPAN2 weekend schedule helps expand the channel's programming beyond politics. Most episodes of "Book TV" feature discussions with authors of nonfiction books, usually in the form of interviews, lectures or seminars. The series sometimes includes coverage of major book fairs and festivals. Some of the notable names who have appeared on the show include David Mamet and Tom Clancy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Classroom lectures on American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historic speeches of former U.S. presidents as well as their policies and legacies.
